comments.author: Jerod Santo
comments.message:
Cool tool! It reminds me of (the now defunct, I just learned) FollowCost[1], which was valuable in seeing how annoying somebody will be *before* you follow them.

I keep pretty tight reigns on my Twitter stream for some of the same reasons that you do, and Busyness can definitely help with that.

The one criticism I have of the tool is that my results didn't surprise me at all. Perhaps it's because I pay close attention to Twitter and I know which of the people I follow tweet the most. Regardless, it served to reenforce my intuition.

Oh, and that brogrammer joke is almost *too* good. Well played.

[1]: http://thenextweb.com/2008/...

replies.author: zachleat
replies.message:
Yeah, something like FollowCost would have been much easier to build and scale! Much fewer API calls there. I might steal their last 100 tweets idea.

(At least 20% of the reason I wanted to build this was a desire to use that joke.)

comments.author: Mike Taylor
comments.message: This is super cool, thanks guys! It actually helped me find some accounts that I forgot I was following--because they haven't tweeted in years (e.g., https://twitter.com/reddit_..., my 2nd busiest result... heh).
